definition-item.definition-title: AUTOMATIC CONTROL, STARTING, SYNCHRONISATION OR STABILISATION OF GENERATORS OF ELECTRONIC OSCILLATIONS OR PULSES (generation of oscillations H03B)

section-body.paragraph-text: Automatic control circuits for generators of electronic oscillations or pulses; starting, synchronization, or stabilization circuits for generators where the type of generator is irrelevant or unspecified.

table-column.paragraph-text: Generation of oscillations

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Control or regulation of electric motors, electric generators or dynamo-electric converters; Controlling transformers, reactors or choke coils
Pulse technique

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: automatic control
covers only closed loop systems

definition-item.definition-title: Stabilisation of generator output against variations of physical values, e.g. power supply

section-body.paragraph-text: Stabilisation of generator output against variations caused by environmental variations such as temperature, process variations when the generator is (partly) integrated on an electronic chip, aging of the components constituting the generator.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Against variations of temperature only
Automatic control
Modifications of generator, of oscillations using amplifier with regenerative feedback from output to input, to compensate for variations in physical values.
Modifications of generator, for generating electric pulses, to compensate for variations in physical values.

section-body.paragraph-text: Documents disclosing compensation against temperature variations and against another physical parameter are classified in the subgroup H03L1/02 in addition to H03L1/00.

definition-item.definition-title: {of generators comprising distributed capacitance and inductance}

section-body.paragraph-text: Said distributed capacitances and inductances could be also delay lines, microstrips, and the like.

definition-item.definition-title: {by using voltage variable capacitance diodes}

section-body.paragraph-text: All devices having a variable capacitance e.g. Junction capacitors, MOS-capacitors, and the like.

definition-item.definition-title: Constructional details for maintaining temperature constant

section-body.paragraph-text: also ovens for maintaining temperature constant

definition-item.definition-title: Automatic control of voltage, current, or power

section-body.paragraph-text: Arrangements for automatic controlling the output level/amplitude of the generator. The output of the generator could be a voltage, current or power.

Control of voltage, current or power wherein the generators are not generators for electronic oscillations or pulses, e.g. level shifts, power management, power supply regulators, automatic transmission power control, are not classified in H03L.

definition-item.definition-title: of power

section-body.paragraph-text: Arrangements for automatic controlling the output power level of the generator.

definition-item.definition-title: Automatic control of frequency or phase; Synchronisation

list-item.paragraph-text: Automatic control of the frequency or phase of the output of the generator;

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Tuning of resonant circuits in general
Synchronising in digital communication systems, see the relevant groups in class

definition-item.definition-title: using a frequency discriminator comprising a passive frequency-determining element

section-body.paragraph-text: All means for converting the frequency to any of voltage, current or digital signal e.g. frequency-to-voltage converter, frequency-to-current converter, frequency-to-digital converter.

definition-item.definition-title: wherein the frequency-determining element comprises distributed inductance and capacitance

section-body.paragraph-text: Distributed capacitances and inductances could be also delay lines, microstrips, and the like.

definition-item.definition-title: using a reference signal applied to a frequency- or phase-locked loop

section-body.paragraph-text: The reference signal is a frequency reference signal including constant frequency signal, data signal, and the like.

section-body.paragraph-text: Using several loops, each loop having each its own controlled oscillator and/or phase shifter.

section-body.paragraph-text: the "loop" meaning a Phase-locked loop (PLL) or a Delay-locked loop (DLL).

definition-item.definition-title: {concerning mainly a recovery circuit for the reference signal}

section-body.paragraph-text: Recovery circuit for recovering the reference signal from the input signal, e.g. data signal.

table-column.paragraph-text: Synchronisation of receiver with transmitter using the transitions of the received signal to control the phase of the synchronising-signal-generating means, e.g. using a phase-locked loop

definition-item.definition-title: provided with an additional controlled phase shifter {(H03L7/0998 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Controlled phase shifter in the loop e.g. delay element, phase selector, phase interpolator, and the like.
This subgroup does not include additional phase shifter outside the loop e.g. in the reference path or in the output path.

section-body.paragraph-text: Controlled phase shifter which is digitally controlled e.g. by a register and/or an up-down counter.

definition-item.definition-title: using special filtering or amplification characteristics in the loop (H03L7/087 - H03L7/091 take precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: Loop filtering, amplification, or any other manipulation of the signal provided by the phase/frequency detector which results in a control signal for the controlled oscillator of the loop.

definition-item.definition-title: using a lock detector (H03L7/087 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: Lock detectors without any detailed features. The lock detectors without detailed features are classified in other subgroups according to the purpose/use of the said lock detector.

definition-item.definition-title: using a comparator for comparing the voltages obtained from two frequency to voltage converters

section-body.paragraph-text: Frequency to voltage converters converting the frequency of the reference signal and the frequency of the feedback signal to a voltage, current or digital signal. The voltage, current or digital signal is used by the comparator.
